entry.title: budweiser wings
entry.content:
Story

Wings and Budweiser. Do we really need much more of a story than that? Generally I’d say no, but we had a trial by fire experience that I think it would be good to share for safety’s sake. We had some friends over last night, had the wings going in the oven after the parboil (you’ll find out about that part below), and the apartment began to fill with smoke. I opened the oven and was met a grease fire – so this is trial by fire in the most literal sense. I dove in, potholder first and pulled out the flaming pan, set it down on the stove and got it to go out, switched to a throwaway aluminum pan instead of a cookie sheet wrapped with foil and we were back in business. Hopefully by us going through that, no one else has to to enjoy these delicious wings infused with Budweiser.

Recipe

Budweiser Baked Wings

rotio
Published: February 2, 2014
Wings infused with Budweiser topped with some HOT sauce.
5.0 2 reviews
Prep time (including brine): 6h
Cook time: 1h
Total time: 7h
Yield: 6 lbs Serving size: Half recipe Calories per serving: 500 Fat per serving: 5g

Equipment:

Throw away alumninum pan or other pan with sides

Ingredients:

Chicken wings: 6 lbs
Thyme: 2 T
Salt: 1/2 c
Garlic Powder: 1/4 c
Budweiser: 8 (plus a few to drink)

Sauce:
Srirachi: 3 T
Honey: 1 c

Directions:

Brine:
1. Create a brine by mixing salt, garlic powder, and thyme into enough water to cover wings.
2. Brine chicken in refrigerator for 6 to 12 hours – if you don’t have space in your fridge, just add ice every hour or so to maintain temperature.
3. Remove chicken from brine.


Cook:
4. Preheat oven to 450 F
5. Bring Budweiser to a boil in a pot large enough to fit the beer plus your wings. I know it’s hard to dump the Budweiser into a pot instead of drinking them but that’s why the recipe calls for a few extra to dirnk. Now’s a good time to pour one of those for yourself if you haven’t yet.
6. Boil wings for 8 minutes, turning regularly to ensure even cooking.
7. Remove from pot and dry thoroughly. Place in sprayed throwaway aluminum pan or other pan with high edges. Once that fat starts rendering in the oven, you don’t want the drippings going everywhere and lighting on fire like mine did. A wire rack in a pan with high edges is even better.
8. Bake for 40 minutes or until wings are very crispy. Flip the wings once at about 30 minutes to ensure even crisping.

Sauce:
9. Make your favorite sauce. For ours we used honey and Sriracha. Be careful with the ratios and taste before you add to the wings to ensure your heat level is where you want it.
10. Toss wings in sauce and serve with a Budweiser.

entry.title: shrimp pad thai
entry.content:
Story

Pad thai is delicious, but all those noodles can be a bit heavy if you’re looking for a lighter mid-week meal. I received a request from one of my best friends, Nicolai, to post something Paleo. This isn’t by any means hardcore Paleo, but swapping out the pasta for spaghetti squash definitely gets it closer than most things I cook. You’ll find that by slightly undercooking the squash you can achieve that nice level of “toothiness” of aldente noodles. We’ve done this recipe several times now, including ingredients like bacon, scrambled eggs, bean sprouts, and red onion. The combination you’ll find below is pretty hearty and delicious from the peanut butter but has a nice kick from the combination of the hot sauce and the briny pickled cherry peppers along with the lime juice. Try it out, modify it, play with it, enjoy it!

Recipe

Spaghetti Squash Shrimp Pad Thai

rotio
Published: January 30, 2014
Shrimp Pad Thai, with spaghetti squash where the noodles used to be.
5.0 2 reviews
Prep time: 10 minutes
Cook time: 45 min
Total time: 55 min
Yield: 2 servings Serving size: Half recipe Calories per serving: 500 Fat per serving: 5g

Equipment:

Wok (ideally a wok but you can definitely make it work with any large pan or skillet)

Ingredients:

Spaghetti Squash: 1
Large Raw Shrimp (these were 16-20 per pound): 8-10

Sauce:
Peanut Butter: 2 T
Cholula Chili Garlic Hot Sauce: 4 T
Low Sodium Soy Sauce: 2 T
Rice Wine Vinegar: 1 tsp
Garlic Powder: 1 tsp
Crushed Red Pepper: pinch
Agave, Honey, or Brown Sugar: to taste

Stir Fry:
Coconut Oil (canola or vegetable will also work fine): 3 T
Garlic: 3 cloves, minced
Sweet Cherry Peppers: 4 peppers, seeded and julienned
Peanuts: 1/4 c, crushed
Lime: 2 wedges

Directions:

Squash:
1. Preheat oven to 450 F.
2. Split squash along the long axis and remove seeds.
3. Roast face-down on pan for 30 min .
4. Remove squash, allow to cool until you can feel comfortable scraping it out, then scrape out the “spaghetti” with a fork.

Sauce:
5. Mix all sauce ingredients. Microwave if necessary to combine. Adjust amount of sweetener to your liking.

Stir Fry:
6. Heat coconut oil in a wok until it begins to smoke.
7. Fry shrimp in oil for about two minutes (tops), turning once. Remove when cooked through.
8. Add garlic and cherry peppers to hot oil and cook for about 3 minutes until you get some solid caramelization.
9. Add sauce and the spaghetti squash. Mix or toss to combine.
10. Add cooked shrimp and toss to combine.
11. Plate and top with peanuts and lime.

entry.title: new jersey pizza
entry.content:
Story

“I’ll take a large plain pie.” In Jersey, this statement will get you set up with a piping hot disk of deliciousness like the one above. Since moving to Saint Louis in 2013, all this request has gotten us has been puzzled looks. Best case scenario and you have someone who understands, you get a nice flat square-cut Saint Louis style pizza covered in Provel ® (a mixture of cheddar, Swiss, and provolone) like this “beauty” below: Not being satisfied with the above, we decided to seek out a place that would make it like home. We found two spots, Racanelli’s New York Style Pizza and Ferraro’s Jersey Style Pizza (they even have Taylor Ham/Pork Roll!). Both places are good, but this led me to another question – if I love to cook so much, then why haven’t I mastered one of my favorite things to eat? So I set out with the initial goal to make something that tastes as good as the average at home. I think I’ve finally accomplished that, what better way to reintroduce rotio/food to the world.

Recipe

New Jersey Pizza

rotio
Published: January 26, 2014
This is a classic Jersey style pie. Cost for a medium comes out to about $2.50
5.0 2 reviews
Prep time (including overnight rise): 24 hours
Cook time: 6 min
Total time: 24 hour 6 min
Yield: 2 (medium) 14” pies Serving size: 1 medium pie Calories per serving: 600 Fat per serving: 4g

Equipment:

Pizza Stone

Ingredients:

Dough:
Bread Flour: 390g (3c)
Water: 8.5oz
Yeast: 1.75g
Salt: 8g (1.5tsp)
Sugar: 4g (1tsp)
Olive Oil: 1.5tsp

Sauce: (this makes a lot, freeze extra)
Tomato Puree: 28oz (Good tomatoes = good sauce, find the one you like)
Water: 1/3c
Garlic: 1tsp
Salt: 3/4tsp
Black Pepper: Pinch
Sugar: 1tsp
Red Pepper: Pinch
Olive Oil: 2tsp
Oregano: 1tsp

Cheese:
Mozzarella (whole milk, not part-skim – low moisture is ok – full block, not shredded): 8oz total for both pies

Directions:

Dough:
1. Mix all dry ingredients
2. Place water (cool to room temperature) in a large bowl
3. Add half of dry ingredients to water, mix to combine and leave alone for 10 minutes to allow flour to hydrolyze. This lets the water break the flour into its component sugars for the yeast to digest.
4. Mix vigorously for 3 to 5 minutes. Mixing at this stage is more efficient than kneading after all the flour is incorporated.
5. Add the rest of the dry ingredients slowly until all is incorporated into a dough ball.
6. Add olive oil and knead in bowl for 3 to 5 minutes – while mixing was great for the first half of the flour, we still have to work the second half of the flour during this stage.
7. Divide into 2 balls and place dough in plastic bags. Refrigerate for 24-72 hours. (Longer slow rise will yield a more flavorful dough).

Sauce:
8. Mix all sauce ingredients.

Assembly:
9. Remove dough from refrigerator at least 1 hour prior to cooking.
10. Preheat oven with pizza stone on top shelf to 550 degrees (F) for at least 1 hour.
11. Grate mozzarella and place in freezer while preparing dough.
12. Stretch each dough ball to approximately 14 inches on floured pizza peel or cutting board (do not roll, the more bubbles in the dough, the better, be gentle).
13. Top (sparingly) with sauce, too much and you will have a soggy pie. A ladle and a half is plenty. Shake peel/board to ensure dough is still loose from board.
14. Remove cheese from freezer and sprinkle onto pies.
15. Slide onto pizza stone in oven and cook for 5-7 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.
16. Thank me later.

Recipe and technique adapted from feeling foodish and Varasano’s
